TopicTitle: Sentinel-2A launch atop Vega VV05 June 23rd

Articles.Content:
Hey, Arianespace will be launching sentinel-2A on June 23rd atop a VV05 Vega rocket from the Kourou spaceport at 01:51:58 GMT, 22:51:58 Kourou Time and 21:51:58 Washington time.

Sentinel-2A is a satellite of the [Copernicus program](http://www.copernicus.eu/), wich is an Earth-mapping and observation program for agriculture, soil studies and data from the coasts of the oceans.

Stream will be on the Arianespace website, with commentary starting at T-15minutes.

Video of Sentinel-2A being enclosed in fairing and mounted on the launcher : 

<iframe width="480" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/a_oULG5phqo?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>

Video of sentinel-2A's solar panels deployment test : (funny: it only has one big array on one side, not one per side!)

<iframe width="480" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/rhWN2aLVi-I?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>

Sadly launch will occur at 3 a.m. in my place and i have an exam the next morning at 7:00, so i won't be watching it :/

**Edited <time datetime="2015-06-21T11:32:30Z" title="06/21/2015 11:32  AM" data-short="9 yr">June 21, 2015</time> by Hcube**

Thanks for the head up ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif) I love watching Vega launches - this rockets streaks up like bat out of Hell ![:cool:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cool.gif)

> 
> Thanks for the head up ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif) I love watching Vega launches - this rockets streaks up like bat out of Hell ![:cool:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cool.gif)

yeah right ! ? it's a very funny launcher.

Actually its TWR is not *that* high : it's about 1.7... although i agree it does look like Vega lifts off much faster than Ariane 5, wich has a TWR of 1.8 depending on the payload ! i'll have to watch two clips side by side and compare...
Well, guess it depends on how close the cameras are from the launcher ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
That fairing probably weighs like 9 tons. Definitely not worth it. :-)

> 
> That fairing probably weighs like 9 tons. Definitely not worth it. :-)

You are WAAAAAY off. The regular fairing is made of aluminium honeycomb and its mass is \*490\* kilograms.

EDIT : about a KSP fairing ? oooooh alriiiight

**Edited <time datetime="2015-06-22T16:54:24Z" title="06/22/2015 04:54  PM" data-short="9 yr">June 22, 2015</time> by Hcube**

> 
> You are WAAAAAY off. The regular fairing is made of aluminium honeycomb and its mass is \*490\* kilograms.

I think he was referring to stock KSP fairings.

Webcast is starting imminently, launch in about fifteen minutes;

[http://www.arianespace.tv](http://www.arianespace.tv)
Man, Vega's quick off the pad. Blinked and I almost missed it.
Vega seems interesting. Almost 2 tonnes to LEO and all solids... Except for a maneuvering stage.

Vega's a nice testbed for experiments on SRBs ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif) the P80 (first stage) is the biggest single segment SRB in use ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif) (the systems it uses (notably the steering system) are a simplified and cheaper version of those used on Ariane V multi segment srbs.

And it will be a great use to test the future ariane VI single segment SRB's ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif) (future version of vega is planned to use one of those SRBs as a replacement of the P80)

Those single segment really allows to lower costs on SRB manufacturing & assembly compared to multi segmented ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif) (and as they don't need seals between segments, that removes some inherent risks of SRBs)

Damn my stupid english exam ! i missed the launch !

Gonna watch the replay i guess...

I kept hoping they would show the map view with the ballistic trajectory. 

How can they fly the thing without it? Maybe they have dual monitors ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)
